results.title: The Principles and application of work sampling
results.creator_credit: Industrial Education Films and Wallace J. Richardson
results.brief_description: Analyses the limitations of traditional work measurement techniques, and demonstrates the advantages of work sampling. The film shows its applications in the engineering, manufacturing, warehousing, office and other areas of industry.

results.title: The Princess diaries
results.creator_credit: Mario Iscovich, Walt Disney Pictures and Garry Marshall
results.brief_description: Mia Thermopolis is a bright but terribly shy and gawky teenager whose goal in life is to survive each school day with a minimum of attention and embarrassment. Unfortunately, her wish to be invisible is thwarted when her strict grandmother arrives and delivers the shocking news that she’s a real-life princess - heir to the throne of Genovia. Based on the novel by Meg Cabot. Cast includes Anne Hathaway, Heather Matarazzo, Hector Elizondo, Julie Andrews, Mandy Moore, Caroline Goodall.

results.title: The Princess bride [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scheinman, ACT III Communications and Rob Reiner
results.brief_description: A young boy (Fred Savage), bedridden with the flu, is less than thrilled when his grandfather (Peter Falk) arrives to read aloud the book “The Princess bride”. The story, set in the fairyland kingdom of Florin, recounts the adventures of Buttercup (Robin Wright), the most beautiful woman in the world, and Westley (Cary Elwes), the man she loves. The grandfather promises fencing, chases, escapes, love and miracles. His grandson soon discovers that his adventure story delivers much more. Appearances by Billy Crystal, Carol Kane, Mel Smith and more. Music by Mark Knopfler. Based upon the story by William Goldman.

results.title: The Princess and the wonderful weaver
results.brief_description: The progress of Britain’s wool cloth industry from traditional handworking through invention of the spinning jenny, flying shuttle and powered loom to modern fully automated production. The story is traced in a blend of animation and live action. Searching for her Fairy Prince, the Princess models her way through a range of modern fashions, all styled in wool.

results.title: The Princess and the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Allied Filmmakers, Imogen Sutton, Richard Sutton and Richard Williams
results.brief_description: Set in a faraway land of magnificent palaces and beautiful Princesses, a sly thief, a shy cobbler and some very ugly brigands, do battle with an evil sorcerer to save a kingdom and rescue a beautiful princess. Following the tradition of “Aladdin” and “Ali Baba”, this animation is exciting family entertainment, with a wonderful musical score featuring the voices of Bobbi Page and Steve Lively, from “Beauty and the beast” and Vincent Price as the evil Zig Zag.

results.title: The Princess's wedding day
results.brief_description: Highlights of the wedding day of HRH Princess Elizabeth and Philip Mountbatten. Shows the procession of Elizabeth and George VI to Westminster Abbey, the marriage ceremony, the Royal couple with the King, Queen and Queen Mother waving to cheering crowds from the balcony at Buckingham Palace. Narrated by Anna Neagle.

results.title: The Prince of tides
results.creator_credit: Columbia, Barwood Films, Longfellow, Barbra Streisand and Andrew S Karsch
results.brief_description: New York psychiatrist, Susan Lowenstein (Barbra Streisand) confronts her own private pain when she delves into Tom Wingo’s (Nick Nolte) memories of his family’s past. Together they search for the key that may save Tom’s twin sister who repeatedly attempts suicide. Nick Nolte gives the most heartfelt and powerful performance of his career as a man who, in order to mend his sister’s emotional wounds, must finally come to terms with his own. Based on the best-selling novel by Pat Conroy and nominated for seven Academy Awards, this film is a compelling exploration of love - between men and women, parents and children, and, ultimately, love of oneself.

results.title: The Prince of Egypt
results.creator_credit: NBCUniversal, Penney Finkelman Cox, Sandra Rabins, Brenda Chapman, Steve Hickner and Simon Wells
results.brief_description: An animated musical film which tells the story of Moses, based on the book of Exodus in the Old Testament. Follows Moses from the moment his mother sends him out onto the River Nile in a basket of reeds, to his triumphant leading of his people out of slavery in Egypt. In “Prince of Egypt” Dreamworks Pictures attempts to make an animated film on the scale of an epic film. It combines the cute cornball of animated characters and musical numbers with lavish biblical backdrops, such as the magnificently realised parting of the red sea. The cast of voices includes a who’s who of Hollywood stars. (Awards: Winner of 1998 Academy Award for Best Original Song - “When You Believe”)

results.title: The Prince of Central Park
results.creator_credit: Lorimar Film Entertainment and Harvey Hart
results.brief_description: Central Park, New York, inhabited nightly by muggers, rapists and killers, becomes the unlikely venue for two recently orphaned children, Jay Jay and Laurie to find a home. They do however, with Jay Jay proclaiming himself ‘The Prince of Central Park’. Into their world enters a lonely widow (Ruth Gordon), who is eager to share their sense of family and belonging. Based on the novel by Evan Rhodes.
